summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to JP Morgan Chase Bank, dated August 16, 2019, demanding extensive financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell. The subpoena includes a detailed rider specifying the types of records required and requests non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, requesting financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena specifically targets her financial records at JP Morgan Chase, including account details, identification, and transaction history from account inception to present.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is leading the grand jury investigation into Maxwell, evidenced by the subpoena demanding her financial records.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands JP Morgan Chase to appear before the grand jury or produce requested records by this date.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena was issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office to JP Morgan Chase for records related to Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
keyFacts: The subpoena targets Ghislaine Maxwell's financial records at JP Morgan Chase, indicating a focused investigation into her financial activities.
The investigation involves alleged violations of federal criminal law, including statutes related to sex trafficking (18 U.S.C. §§ 1591, 1594(c)), coercion/enticement (2422(b)), and conspiracy (371).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested non-disclosure of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing grand jury investigation.
The subpoena demands a comprehensive range of records, including wire transfers, credit card statements, online banking information, and correspondence related to Maxwell's accounts.
The document reveals Maxwell had multiple phone numbers and an email address (gmax1@ellmax.com) associated with her financial accounts.
